definition: before the troops move, fodder and provisions go first (idiom); logistics comes before military maneuvers/an army marches on its stomach
pinyin: bing1 ma3 wei4 dong4 , liang2 cao3 xian1 xing2

sentences.english: But Yuan Shao was dissatisfied, he does not like the idea of depending on someone to send him provisions.
sentences.chinese: 袁紹覺得等待別人送糧草，不能夠解決根本問題。

sentences.english: Extend the cereal-forage rotation system reinforce the combination of agriculture and animal husbandry.
sentences.chinese: 推廣糧草輪作制度，加強農牧結合。

sentences.english: She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
sentences.chinese: 又說，我們家裏足有糧草，也有住宿的地方。

sentences.english: His only crime consisted in furnishing us with provisions.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的罪名就是供給我們糧草罷了。

sentences.english: Military strategy requires that food and fodder should go ahead, and society creation requires that ideology should go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 軍事戰略要求糧草先行，創建社會要求思想先行。

sentences.english: The soldiers husband their strength and their food, waiting for the enemy to attack.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們養精畜銳，節約糧草，以期反擊敵人的進攻。

sentences.english: What situation about our grain preparation?
sentences.chinese: 我們的糧草準備的如何？

sentences.english: She teaches them to fish, forage, hunt, and defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 她教他們捕魚，搜尋糧草，追捕，和防衛它們自己。

sentences.english: The army requisitioned the village for army provisions.
There is no food grass, they will give it a gamble and extra probably directly paint back troops.
sentences.chinese: 沒有糧草，他們會放手一搏，更可能直接退兵。

sentences.english: Now that their grain is nearly consumed, we should take this chance and strike severally.
sentences.chinese: 今操糧草已盡，正可乘此機會，兩路擊之。

definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
